followup-kent-state-uxd.title: Followup: Kent State's user experience design program
followup-kent-state-uxd.excerpt: About a year ago, I wrote a post about enrolling in Kent State University's User Experience Design (UXD) Master's program. Since most of those people were asking the same questions, I thought I'd write a followup post to talk about my experience now, as I'm more than halfway through the program.

remote-testing-results.title: Remote usability testing results
remote-testing-results.excerpt: Even though I only had 12 participants, I learned a lot from my first unmoderated remote usability test.

remote-usability-tests.title: Remote testing with Loop11
remote-usability-tests.excerpt: This week, we set up remote, unmoderated usability tests with Loop11. It was a bit of a train wreckâ€”but probably an excellent primer for conducting quick usability tests in the real world, so to speak.

first-usability-test.title: My First Usability Test
first-usability-test.excerpt: This week, the assignment in my Usability I class at Kent State was to moderate a usability test.

concept-mapping-familiar-subjects.title: Concept mapping familiar subjects
concept-mapping-familiar-subjects.excerpt: I've found concept maps to be very helpful, especially at the beginning of a project.

kent-state-uxd.title: Enrolling in the user experience design program at Kent State University
kent-state-uxd.excerpt: This Fall, I started Kent State University's Master's program in User Experience Design. Until this year, I never thought I'd enroll in graduate school at all, and I certainly never thought I'd enjoy it. Fortunately, I was wrong.
